src.database package

Submodules

src.database.db_manager module

class src.database.db_manager.DatabaseManager(db_path: str = 'chat.db')[source]

Bases: object

Manages all database operations for the chat system.

This class handles: - User account management (creation, verification, deletion) - Message storage and retrieval - Message status tracking (read/unread, delivered/undelivered) - Chat partner relationships - Message history and pagination

The database schema consists of: 1. accounts: Stores user accounts and password hashes 2. messages: Stores all messages with metadata and delivery status 3. chat_preferences: Stores chat-specific preferences (e.g. message_limit)

All methods include proper error handling and logging.

create_account(username: str, password: str) → bool[source]

Create a new user account.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – Desired username

  • password (str) – User’s password

Returns:

True if account created successfully, False if username exists or error occurs

Return type:

bool

Note

Password is hashed using bcrypt before storage. Username must be unique.

verify_login(username: str, password: str) → bool[source]

Verify user login credentials.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – Username to verify

  • password (str) – Password to verify

Returns:

True if credentials are valid, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

Note

Uses bcrypt to verify password against stored hash.

get_unread_message_count(username: str) → int[source]

Get total number of unread messages for a user.

Parameters:

username (str) – Username to check

Returns:

Number of unread messages across all conversations

Return type:

int

Note

Only counts messages where user is the recipient.

delete_account(username: str) → bool[source]

Delete a user account and all associated messages.

Parameters:

username (str) – Username of account to delete

Returns:

True if account deleted successfully, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

Note

This operation cascades to delete all messages sent by or to the user.

Check if a username exists in the database.

Parameters:

username (str) – Username to check

Returns:

True if user exists, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

store_message(sender: str, recipient: str, content: str, is_delivered: bool = False, forced_id: int | None = None) → int | None[source]

Store a new message in the database. If forced_id is given, use that exact ID.

mark_messages_as_read(username: str, message_ids: List[int] | None = None) → bool[source]

Mark messages as read for a user.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – Username of message recipient

  • message_ids (Optional[List[int]], optional) – Specific message IDs to mark. If None, marks all messages as read. Defaults to None.

Returns:

True if operation successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

Note

Only marks messages where user is the recipient.

list_accounts(pattern: str = '', page: int = 1, per_page: int = 10) → Dict[str, Any][source]

List user accounts with optional pattern matching and pagination.

Parameters:

  • pattern (str, optional) – Username pattern to filter by. Defaults to “”.

  • page (int, optional) – Page number (1-based). Defaults to 1.

  • per_page (int, optional) – Results per page. Defaults to 10.

Returns:

Dictionary containing:

’users’: List of usernames, ‘total’: Total matching accounts, ‘page’: Current page number, ‘per_page’: Results per page

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

get_messages_for_user(username: str, offset: int = 0, limit: int = 10) → Dict[str, Any][source]

Get all messages for a user with pagination.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – Username to get messages for

  • offset (int, optional) – Number of messages to skip. Defaults to 0.

  • limit (int, optional) – Maximum messages to return. Defaults to 10.

Returns:

Dictionary containing:

’messages’: List of message dictionaries, ‘total’: Total message count

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Parameters:

  • username (str) – Username of message owner

  • message_ids (List[int]) – List of message IDs to delete

Returns:

bool

  • user2 (str) – Second username

  • limit (int, optional) – Maximum messages to return. Defaults to 999999.

’messages’: List of message dictionaries, ‘total’: Total number of messages

get_message_limit(username: str) → Any[source]

Retrieve the message limit for the given user.

Parameters:

username (str) – Username to retrieve the limit for

Returns:

The message limit. Defaults to 50 if not set or error occurs.

Return type:

int

get_chat_message_limit(username: str, partner: str) → Any[source]

Retrieve the message limit for a specific conversation between a user and a partner. If no record exists, insert a default limit of 50.

update_chat_message_limit(username: str, partner: str, limit: int) → bool[source]

Update the message limit for a specific conversation.
